channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: Young Professionals Briefing: The State of U.S. Defense Policy
item.description:
CFR Military Fellows discuss their career pathways and how U.S. defense policy has evolved through their years in service.
The CFR Young Professionals Briefing Series provides an opportunity for those early in their careers to engage with CFR. The briefings feature remarks by experts on critical global issues and lessons learned in their careers. These events are intended for individuals who have completed their undergraduate studies and have not yet reached the age of thirty to be eligible for CFR term membership.

item.title: In China’s Orbit: Beijing’s Space Diplomacy in the Global South
item.description: China is using its dual-use space industry to lock in long-term influence across the Global South, creating strategic, economic, and security dependencies that will shape the future balance of power in orbit.

item.title: The Costs and Global Trade-Offs of U.S. Military Action Against Venezuela
item.description: U.S. military operations in the Caribbean, now in their sixth month, cost $31 million per day, $3 million of which is unbudgeted. The larger cost is the strategic trade-off in the allocation of military assets: Forces in the Caribbean are not available for other hotspots.

item.title: New Executive Order Ties U.S. Critical Minerals Security to Global Partnerships
item.description: A new executive order makes international cooperation central to U.S. critical minerals security, targeting processed minerals where China dominates. It pairs allied supply agreements with trade tools—and potential price supports—to reduce vulnerabilities.

item.title: From Fraud to the Frontlines: Scam Centers Caught in the Cambodia-Thailand Conflict
item.description: In December 2025, Thailand struck Cambodian casino and hotel complexes, which it says were scam centers being used by the military. Though contested, the strikes show how a border dispute and transnational crime have become intertwined.
